content.question: Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>2</mtext> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≦</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≦</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>2</mtext> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≦</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≦</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) If the line x = k divides R into two regions of equal area, what is the value of k?

(c) What is the average value of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>2</mtext> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> on the interval <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≦</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≦</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
